attributes.description: Specifies the type of ignition system employed, such as capacitor discharge or magneto.
attributes.name: ignitionType

attributes.description: Indicates the system's operational temperature range to tolerate aircraft engine environments.
attributes.name: temperatureRange

attributes.description: Defines the maximum allowable voltage to prevent component damage.
attributes.name: voltageLimit

designScenario.description: The ignition system is a critical component within the aircraft designed to ignite the fuel-air mixture in the engine cylinders, ensuring reliable engine startup and operation across various conditions.
designScenario.name: Ignition System

details.description: The system must reliably produce and deliver a spark at the appropriate timing for efficient engine operation.
The system should operate with high efficiency and quick response times under standard and emergency conditions.
Include safeguards to manage electrical faults and prevent fire or spark hazards.
The system should be easy to install and resilient to wear, reducing maintenance overhead.

relationships.description: The Spark Plug is dependent on the Ignition Coil for high voltage supply.
The Ignition Control Unit aggregates signals from the Engine Sensors to regulate timing.

systemComponents.description: Converts low-voltage power to high voltage necessary for spark generation.
systemComponents.name: Ignition Coil

subComponents.description: Conducts and modulates current for inductive increase.
subComponents.name: Primary Coil

subComponents.description: Supplies the elevated voltage to the distributor.
subComponents.name: Secondary Coil

systemComponents.description: Generates a spark to ignite the air-fuel mixture within the combustion chamber.
systemComponents.name: Spark Plug

subComponents.description: Conducts high voltage to the electrode tip.
subComponents.name: Electrode Assembly

subComponents.description: Isolates electrical current to focus the discharge at the tip.
subComponents.name: Insulator

systemComponents.description: Controls ignition timing and processes inputs from sensors and pilot commands.
systemComponents.name: Ignition Control Unit

subComponents.description: Processes input data to adjust spark timings effectively.
subComponents.name: Processor Module

subComponents.description: Enables communication and adjustments by maintenance personnel.
subComponents.name: Diagnostic Interface

systemComponents.description: Monitors engine states like temperature and crankshaft position to optimize ignition.
systemComponents.name: Engine Sensors

subComponents.description: Detects crankshaft position for precise spark timing.
subComponents.name: Crankshaft Sensor

comments.body: Ignition System generates reliable ignition spark and ensures precise timing for combustion.

rag_context: The Ignition System generates a reliable ignition spark to initiate combustion at the precise moment required.
